title: IBD Smart NYSE + Nasdaq Tables -- Aug 15, 2025
content:
Unsurpassed and ratings to help you .

Exceptional stocks with earnings growth, market-leading price performance and other fundamentals appear at the top of a sector list and show additional important data.

IBD gives you ratings to tell you which stocks out of thousands are the best performers. We classify the stocks in 33 industry sectors and list the sectors from strongest to weakest.

IBD Composite Rating: combines the EPS Rating, Relative Strength Rating, Industry Group Strength, SMR Rating and Acc/Dis Rating. Ranks 1 to 99, with 99 the best. For a description of other Ratings click here.

Click on the sector name to see stock prices and their ratings

Earnings Per Share (EPS) rating: compares a stocks last 2 quarters and 3 year EPS growth to all stocks. Ranks 1 to 99, with 99 the best. Rating of 90 means it outperformed 90% of all stocks.

Relative Strength (RS) rating: Stocks relative price change in last 12 months vs all stocks. Ranks 1 to 99. Best rating is 80 or more.

Sales+Profit+ROE (SMR) rating: combines sales, profit margins and return on equity into an A to E rating. ROE over 17% is preferred.

Accumulation / Distribution (Acc/Dis) rating: our proprietary price and volume formula shows if a stock is under accumulation (buying) or distribution (selling) in the last 3 months. A=buying, E=selling.

52 Week High is in blue if within 10% of its new high.

Vol % Change is volume traded yesterday vs average daily volume last 50 days. Vol % Chg. +50% & up are in blue.

Blue Stock Names are up one point or more or at a new high. Red stock names are down 1 point or more or at a new low.

r = repurchased stock in last year; x = ex dividend or ex rights; k = earnings due within four weeks; e = earnings in IBD today; o = stock has options
summary: The International Distributive Association (IBD) has developed a list of top 10 stocks in 33 industry sectors and lists them from strongest to weakest. The association gives ratings to identify these stocks with earnings growth, market-leading price performance, and other fundamentals. The EPS Rating, Relative Strength Rating, Industry Group Strength, SMR Rating and Acc/Dis Rating are among these ratings. The company's composite rating combines these ratings and the Sales+Profit+ROE rating, which is 80 or more than 90% of all stocks. Other ratings include an 80-plus rating for sales, profit margins and return on equity, with an over-17% rating.
shortSummary: IBD's Smart NYSE + Nasdaq Tables show exceptional stocks with exceptional earnings growth, market-leading price performance, and significant market fundamentals, with ratings based on individual factors.
argos_summary: The article explains how IBD rates stocks across 33 industry sectors using a composite score that combines EPS growth, relative strength, industry group strength, SMR (sales, profit, ROE), and accumulation/distribution metrics. Each rating ranges from 1 to 99 or A–E, with higher numbers indicating stronger performance. The piece also details visual cues such as color-coded stock names, 52‑week high indicators, and volume change highlights to help investors quickly identify top performers.
